claim:
Treatment condition coded as MRT = 1, UC = 0, where MRT = moral reconation therapy and UC = usual care; TriPM = Triarchic Psychopathy Measure; PICTS = Psychological Inventory of Criminal Thinking Scale; MCAA = Measures of Criminal Attitudes and Associates; CI = confidence interval.

aEffect sizes for continuous outcomes are standardized mean differences (i.e., Cohen’s d), calculated from the results of linear mixed effect models and the standard deviation of the outcome at baseline.


bEffect sizes for count outcomes are incidence rate ratios (IRRs), calculated from results of Poisson generalized linear mixed effect models.


*p < .05;


**p < .01;


***p < .001

Figure 1.
title: Figure 1.
caption:
Estimated Marginal Means with 95% Bootstrap Confidence Intervals for the Significant Moderation of Treatment Effects on Criminal Thinking
Note. MRT = moral reconation therapy; UC = usual care; PICTS = Psychological Inventory of Criminal Thinking Scale.
